summary: This is an internal FBI email from August 6, 2019, regarding the planning of a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. It details tentative travel plans for FBI agents and the expected timeline for the search operation.

persons.name: Sean
persons.role: FBI Supervisory Special Agent (SSA) - Squad C-20
persons.context: The sender of the email, coordinating the planning and logistics for the FBI's search warrant execution on Epstein's island. He is with the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in the FBI New York office.

events.title: Expected Warrant Swearing
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting a search warrant affidavit for Epstein's island, with the expectation the warrant will be sworn out in St. Thomas.

events.title: Planned FBI Departure for Search
events.description: Tentative plan for FBI personnel to fly out to St. Thomas on an FBI Q400 plane to execute the search warrant.

events.title: Planned Search of Epstein's Island
events.description: The search of Epstein's private island off St. Thomas, managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT), is expected to take 1-3 days.

events.title: Planned FBI Return Travel
events.description: Tentative travel day for FBI personnel to return home after the search operation.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island in August 2019.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) from New York was planning to execute the search.
The search operation was planned to last 1-3 days and involved the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).
Tentative travel plans involved the FBI using a Q400 plane to fly personnel to St. Thomas on August 11, 2019.
This email shows active, high-level planning for a significant investigative action against Epstein's properties shortly after his arrest.
